alert.note: Alert for Clay; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 4:59AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Leslie and central Clay Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 458 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Horse Creek Junction, or over Manchester, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Goose Rock, Hector, Ogle, Spurlock and Barcreek around 505 AM EDT. Plank, Botto, Lipps, Peabody, Brightshade and Enline around 510 AM EDT. Marcum, Big Creek, Bear Branch, Ashers Fork and Ice Cliff around 515 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Creekville, Spring Creek, Skidmore, Bobs Fork, Essie, Roark, Queendale, Hosea and Gardner. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 15 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
